Common.SubdivisionName.Common.Text: In between Dollar Tree and Hibbett Sports
In between Hobby Lobby and Boot Barn

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
This shopping center is located on Mariposa Road approximately three miles north of the US-Mexico border. Nogales, Arizona, is a trade area of approximately 41,208 people (Source: Claritas), and the Nogales, Sonora, population is approximately 220,292 people (Source: Claritas, 2010 census). This border traffic adds significantly to the retail trade
for this area. In addition to the fine tenants located in Mariposa Mall, a number of other national retailers are in the area including a Super Walmart, Home Depot and Safeway.  Anchor Tenants: Hobby Lobby, JCPenney, Ross Dress for Less, Marshalls, Boot Barn, Dollar Tree, Shoe
Carnival, Aeropostale, Aaron’s and Forever 21.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Mariposa Mall (Marshalls & Hobby Lobby Now Open)

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
This shopping center is located on Mariposa Road approximately three miles north of the US-Mexico border. Nogales,
Arizona, is a trade area of approximately 41,208 people (Source: Claritas), and the Nogales, Sonora, population is
approximately 220,292 people (Source: Claritas, 2010 census). This border traffic adds significantly to the retail trade
for this area. In addition to the fine tenants located in Mariposa Mall, a number of other national retailers are in the area
including a Super Walmart, Home Depot and Safeway.

Located in the heart of Nogales, Arizona’s, major retail hub, this plaza draws not only from the U.S. side of the border, but is also within easy walking distance to a substantial Sonora, Mexico trade area. A variety of other retailers, restaurants and services would complement the already successful Nogales Plaza.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Lease in The Heart Of Downtown Nogales

Common.Brochures.Common.BrochureName: 40 N Morley Ave (Nogales) Flyer SALE OR LEASE.pdf

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: This iconic retail building is located on Morley Avenue less than 200 feet from the Morley Avenue Pedestrian Border Crossing. Thousands of pedestrians cross here every day to purchase goods and services in Nogales. The building is approximately 7,000 SF and includes a ±3,500 SF ground floor retail area and a ±3,500 SF basement area currently used for storage. The building was formerly occupied by Woolworth. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to own or lease real estate at one of the most active retail areas along the US-Mexico border.

This building is located on Grand Avenue at the lighted intersection of Grand
Avenue and Park Street in downtown Nogales. It is one of the most visible
buildings in the downtown Nogales area. The property sits just steps away from
two major Ports of Entry for vehicular and pedestrian crossing between the U.S.
and Mexico. In addition, the property is located adjacent to Morley Avenue which
is one of the main retail avenues in downtown Nogales. Nogales, Arizona is 60
miles south of Tucson, AZ on Interstate 19 and is one of the major points of entry
with an Average Daily Border Crossing of 27,000 people per day (FFY 2013 9.7
Million crossers)* This is an excellent opportunity for a tenant to acquire a
freestanding building with excellent visibility and high pedestrian traffic in Nogales.
